comment: This professor is an open minded person who understands that people's POV's are based on what their culture dictates. He is happy to “meet you where you are” and investigates, with care and understanding, what each people group needs. His classes were fun and engaging, and he graded based on that engagement level. You NEED to do the readings!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: The class was okay if you already know about government. There were only 2 tests and a project. He didn't set us up well for the project and the tests have nothing to do with the lectures, so make sure you know about the government. The lectures are long and kinda boring but sometimes get interesting. :/
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Hes a great professor, sometimes you goes off on a topic. You definitely know his political views but if you can explain your reasoning behind how you feel he is very understanding and loves a good conversion. Overall loved his class, textbook is "required" but if you don't get it you could survive - but you will not pass the pop quizzes without it

Prof. Franke will probably end up being one of my favorite teachers of all time. His lectures are thought-provoking and extremely entertaining, I would recommend this class even if you don't need it for your major.

There's textbook readings almost every week but they aren't particularly long. Professor Franke makes you a more politically active citizen, and his lectures are discussion based, so be prepared to talk. He's clearly passionate about his work, and although he is politically biased, his lectures are still enjoyable with an open mind.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures are boring and quiet when its online. He is hard to understand and I dont believe he truly understands government, seems more in favor of his German government which is where hes from. He also has an evident political bias. The tests and quizzes are easy but his blog entry assignments are graded hella hard.

I really enjoyed Dr. Franke's American Government class. Our class had five pop quizzes based on the reading, so many sure you stay up to date. Papers aren't toughly graded. The midterm and final are demanding but fair so make sure you study! Class lectures are interesting and participation goes a long way. Class made me more politically-active.

Gives amazing and thought-provoking lectures but you must show up to class and do the readings to pass his tests. Overall a very caring, intelligent, and interesting professor but if you have trouble staying focused during lecture-based classes with little to no notes and just want an easy A, look elsewhere.

3 papers that aren't hard. A midterm and a final. No quizzes. Professor expects you to have read the chapters before class so that you can have an educated discussion. Doesn't care if you're on your phone. Lectures aren't boring because he wants it to be a discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: challenges you to think, great lectures, hard exams, easy paper

I took Dr. Volker for a basic course. He made it less monotonous and more interesting by having fantastic lectures. The book put me to sleep, his lectures made me feel more interested in politics. I think he's a fantastic professor and does a great job of getting students interested and participating in his courses.

Professor Franke is very opinionated, but I definitely gained a broader knowledge over the semester. His lectures get off topic A LOT, which makes it hard to take notes. The biggest downside is that not a single grade was put in D2L all semester, so I didn't know until it showed up in OWL Express. I still had to email the TA to know my exact grade.

Dr. Franke is very knolwedgeable about International affairs and relations. Required readings for discussions in class (which get off topic). Statecraft requires planning and cooperation from your group! Grades are not posted in D2L, wont know until the end. You will learn to connect theories to the real world. He challenges you to think!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is a professor that makes you think and relates the studies back to what is going on in the world. However, YOU MUST READ!  Overall it was a good class.

Dr. Franke makes you think. He also likes interaction and participation in class. He makes you work for your grade, but he is fair. I had him during the summer. The tests were a mix of multiple choice, short answer, and definitions. Definitely read up on the key terms in the book. He and his TA are happy to answer questions in or out of class.

This Prof teaches what he teaches in his masters courses in his bachelors courses.  He is very hard and if you think this is an easy A you are dead wrong!  If you are an A student you will most likely get a C.  A large amount of the students dropped his class but I stayed and wish I had dropped him. No one got an A or even a high B on the midterm!

This professor teaches his doctoral thesis.  His grades are a midterm, group project and a final.  There are homework assignments the first half of the semester, and then only group work. Reading the text is essential, although infrequently covered.  Learning SPSS would greatly benefit the student.  This is a watered down statistics course. Tough.
